alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Denton County through 345 PM CDT... At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flower Mound, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Frisco, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Coppell, The Colony, Southlake, Highland Village, Lake Dallas, Lake Lewisville, Hickory Creek, Hebron and Lakewood Village. This includes Interstate 35E between mile markers 447 and 456. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
